contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=February 2009}} {{Interventions infobox | Name = Ultraviolet light therapy | Image = | Caption = | ICD10 = {{ICD10PCS|6A8|6/A/8}} | ICD9 = {{ICD9proc|99.82}} | MeshID = D014467 | OPS301 = | OtherCodes = | }} '''Ultraviolet light therapy''' or '''ultraviolet Phototherapy''' is a form of treatment for certain skin disorders (including [[atopic|atopic skin disorder]] and [[vitiligo]] when used with [[psoralen]] to form the [[PUVA]] treatment) It consists mostly of the UVA band of [[ultraviolet]] light (fairly closely matching the ultraviolet output from the [[sun]]) and is usually delivered from a [[fluorescent]] bulb specially designed to output this frequency of ultraviolet. This treatment is similar to the light from good quality solariums but differs from the mainly UVB ultraviolet band used to treat [[psoriasis]]. ==See also== * [[light therapy]] {{Extracorporeal assistance, performance, and therapy}} [[Category:Dermatologic procedures]] {{treatment-stub}}
